result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas K. McCourt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas K. McCourt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas K. McCourt was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Thomas K. McCourt was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today.
Must follow requirements of probation.  If Defendant does not make a good faith effort on probation, it may be extended.

miscConds.notes:
Subject to Work Release.
NOT subject to Good Time.
Must complete a COMPAS evaluation and comply with all recommendations.

Restitution of $3492.00 to City of SCF, plus $349.20 surcharge to DA Office for a total of $3841.20 J/S with Scott Swanson 14CF264. 
If not paid during term of probation, amount will be reduced to a civil judgment on behalf of the City/County.
Objections to restitution must be reduced to writing and filed with the Clerk of Court's Office.

May be reduced to civil judgment on behalf of the City/County if not paid at end of probation.  If obj to restitution-must file request in writing.  COMPAS.  Follow requirements of probation.  If do not make good faith effort on probation, it may be extended.

CASES:  14CF127, 14CF263, 14CT31, 14TR683.  Defendant Thomas K. McCourt in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 9:01 am  State - 14CF263 is not resolved - JLA case.  

14CF127:  Def - G plea as to Ct 1.  CT accepts plea, finds Def G, did not enter JOC due to DJOC.  3 yrs.  Bound by all non-monetary bond conditions.  DJOC fee of $150.00 w/in 60 days.  AODA assess w/in 60 days & comply w/any recomm.  Ct 2 - dismissed outright.  

14CT31:  Def - G plea.  CT accepts plea, finds Def G, enters JOC.  SENTENCING:  w/h sent.  1 yr prob. Must stop by prob today by noon. Restitution has been paid. AODA assess & comply.  90 days banked to be used by prob agent if necessary.  $265.60 fine/costs, 60 days to pay.  Abolute Sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs or para, subject to testing.
